title: Lists
description:
Practice using <ul>, &ltol>, and <li> tags to create unordered and ordered lists. 

 Create a basic HTML page. Inside the <body>, create: 
 - An unordered list of 3 fruits (e.g. Apple, Banana, Orange). 
 - An ordered list of 3 daily tasks (e.g. Wake up, Brush teeth, Eat breakfast). 
 - The fruit list should appear with bullet points. 
 - The task list should appear with letters or numbers, depending on the type.

title: Forms and Inputs
description:
Create a form with: 
 - A name field (text) 
 - An email field 
 - A password field 
 - A submit button labeled “Sign in”
example:
<!DOCTYPE html> 
 <html> 
  <head> 
   <title> This is the title! </title> 
  </head> 
  <body> 
   <form> 
    <label for = 'name'> Name </label> 
    <input type = 'text' id = 'name' name = 'username'/> 
    <button type = 'submit'> Send </button> 
   </form> 
  </body> 
 </html>

title: Links
description:
Practice creating clickable links using the anchor (<a>) tag in HTML. Inside the <body>, add the following: 

 1. Text Link: 
 - Create a clickable text link that leads to https://www.wikipedia.org. 
 - The link text should say: 'Visit Wikipedia'. 
 - Make it open in a new tab using the target='_blank' attribute. 

 2. Image Link: 
 - Use a placeholder image from https://placehold.co/150. 
 - Wrap the image in a link so that when the image is clicked, it also goes to https://www.wikipedia.org. 
 - Open the link in the same tab.

title: Selectors
description:
1. Use a tag selector to make all

elements have the font Arial and a font size of 16px. 2. Use a class selector to style all elements with the class info: - Text color: blue - Background color: #e0f0ff 3. Use an ID selector to style the element with the ID important: - Text color: white - Background color: red - Font weight: bold

title: Colors
description:
1. Style the .keyword class to: 
 - Set the text color to green using a keyword. 
 - Set the background color to lightgray. 

 2. Style the .rgb class to: 
 - Set the text color to RGB (255, 0, 0). 
 - Set the background color to RGB (230, 230, 230). 

 3. Style the .hex class to: 
 - Set the text color to #0000ff (blue). 
 - Set the background color to #f0f0f0.

title: Units
description:
1. Style .absolute-heading: 
 - Set the font-size to 24pt (absolute unit). 
 - Add 10px padding. 

 2. Style .relative-heading: 
 - Set the font-size to 2em. 
 - Add 2rem margin-top. 

 3. Style .box-absolute: 
 - Set a width of 300px. 
 - Set a height of 100px. 
 - Use a background color like lightblue. 

 4. Style .box-relative: 
 - Set a width of 50%. 
 - Set a height of 10vh. 
 - Use a background color like lightgreen.

title: Box-model
description:
Style the .box class to show all parts of the box model clearly: 
 - Add padding of 20px on all sides (space between content and border). 
 - Add a solid border of 2px and color it black. 
 - Add a margin of 30px around the box (space between this and other elements). 
 - Give the box a background color (e.g., lightblue) so the content area is visible. 
 - Set a width of 300px to better observe the layout.

title: Layout with flexbox
description:
In the .container class: 
 - Set display to flex to turn it into a flex container. 
 - Set flex-direction to row. 
 - Use justify-content: space-between to spread the items. 
 - Use align-items: center to vertically center them. 
 - Add a gap of 20px between the items.

title: Responsive design & media queries
description:
1. Give '<body>' by default a white background color 
 2. If the screen size reaches less than 600px the background color should switch to yellow.
